revised_title: Gaussian Wave Packets in Inhomogeneous Media with Curved Interfaces: Applications and Phenomena
tldr: This article discusses the application of time-dependent gaussian wave packets as asymptotic solutions to the wave equation for inhomogeneous acoustic media. The authors explore the evolution equations for these wave packets and their properties, with a focus on media with constant velocity gradients. They also present new phenomena associated with wave packets in heterogeneous media and discuss the reflection and transmission of wave packets at interfaces between different media.
